name: Venta el Museo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night here and couldn't fault it. Very helpful owners make you feel most welcome. Despite being the only guests the night we stayed they opened the kitchen and the full menu was available. Food was excellent, as was the bottle of local Almeria wine recommended by the waiter. Again for breakfast the full buffet was laid out solely for us! So many hotels given the low occupancy would have just served a simple breakfast with little or no choice!
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

reviews.text: This place might be a little off the beaten track but if you make the effort to find it you won't be disappointed- a charming town.
reviews.title: A place to feel at home away from home

reviews.text: Its location is a bit remote, however, this makes it an ideal start-off point to visit the near by Almeria race track and for off-road activities, mountainbiking- and hiking. Clean and reasonably equipped room. Very good restaurant & breakfast. Very friendly, competent & helpful (multilingual) hotel-staff- & owner. They make you feel welcome!
reviews.title: DE LUX RUSTIC CHARM

reviews.text: This hotel and restaurant offers top quality accommodation, first class dining with a very welcoming and efficient service. We have stayed overnight on three occasions in the past year. Today we tried lunch which was excellent. The rooms are beautifully furnished, impeccably clean, spacious and are fitted with all mod cons that actually work! Stefan, the chef and manager produces some of the most creative and tastiest dishes to be found in this region. Lucainana de las Torres is an elevated village and the Venta offers spectacular mountain views yet it is easily accessible being about 35 minutes from junction 514 of the E15 in the Almeria direction. Well worth the visit if you are in this area of SE Spain. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lucainena de las Torres...I chose this little town because it was small and therefore less intimidating, also offering easy driving distances to several other locations I wanted to visit. What a joy, we could walk to the main square, the restaurant and bar, the tiny market. You could get lost easily, but without fear.
reviews.title: Exellent hotel

aka: Venta El Museo Lucainena De Las Torres, Spain - Almeria
